This  extraordinary  Lubricating  Compound  is  produced  by  a  chemical  combination  of  suitable 
oily  substances,  purified  by  distillation,  and 

freed  from  the  resinous  or  pitchy  matter  which  attaches  to  all  oils,  more  or  less,  in  their  unrefined 
or  natural  state.     In  operation,  the  PATENT   GREASE  works  free  from  Coomb  or  Gum; 

Friction  by  keeping  the  heaviest  bearings  in  a  soft,  oily  state  to  the  last;  and,  as  its  consistency  is 
not  altered  by  exposure  to  the  hottest  sun  or  coldest  frost,  (its  liquifying  point  being-  200  degrees,) 
it  follows  that,  on  axles  which  have  a  tendency  to  become  hot  from  too  heavy  abrasion,  etc.,  the 
Anti-Friction  vdll  adhere  to  and  keep  them  cool,  when  other  substances  would  run  oft'  and 
become  dry;  thus  the  evil  known  as 

"  ZFVEMUNTGV-    OIF"   ^7Vra3EIXxS" 

is,  by  its  use,  effectually  prevented. 
The  proprietors  will  guarantee  one  application  of  their  PATENT  GREASE  to  carry  the  heaviest 
loaded  team  from  300  to  500  miles,  without  requiring  to  be  regreased  on  the  road. 

HUCKS    &    LAMBERT. 

N.  B.  We  respectfully  caution  our  friends  to  ask  for  Hucks  &  Lambert's 
Patent  Axle  Grease,  as  there  are  several  spurious  imitations  in  the  market. 

Depot,  No.  101  Jackson  Street.    |    Manufactory,  Natoma  Street. 
SAN    FRANCISCO.

■WIRE    ROPE     MAKTTJFACTORTT. 

The  Wire  Rope  Manufactory  established  in  this  city  last  year  has  met  with  very  good  success,  and  the  business  is 
constantly  increasing.  Messrs.  A.  S.  Hallime  &  Co.  employ  some  eight  or  ten  hands,  and  consume  about  16,000 
pounds  of  Iron  Wire  per  month  in  Rope  making.  This  Wire  is  drawn  in  long  length  by  the  Eastern  manufacturers 
expressly  t"r  this  business,  from  the  best  quality  of  American  Iron.  The  principal  consumers  are  the  mining  and 
ferry  interests  Of  this  Hate  and  Oregon,  where  it  is  used  fur  hoisting  from  shafts  and  inclined  planes,  for  pump 
ropes,  derrick  guys,  ferry  ropes,  etc.,  and  the  shipping  visiting  this  port  employ  it  extensively  for  job-stays,  etc. 
Considerable  Copper  Wire  is  also  used  by  this  concern  in  manufacturing  Sfasu  and  Picture  Cord,  and  Lightning 
Conductors.    The  longest  Wire  Rope  made  at  this  manufactory,  without  splice  or  joint,  was  1,800  feet,  or  rather  more 

than  one-third  of  a  mile  long,  and  three  inches  in  circumference.  »'<•'  — "■*  "— ■  •'  °" -  '   -  '  ■-*  •' *•'-  *•» 

make  much  longer  ropes  if  necessary.     Tr.;°  »

flgT"  NON-RESIDENTS,  interested  in  Washoe  or  other  Stocks,  are  invited  to 
make  our  Rooms  their  Head-Quarters  during  their  stay  in  the  City.  The  papers  of 
the  day  and  conveniences  for  writing,  etc.  are  furnished  for  the  use  of  our  customers. 

A  Record  of  Stocks  and  Securities  for  Sale  is  kept  open  for  inspection. 

We  have  reliable  Agents  in  the  Mining  Districts,  from  whom  we  can,  by  Tele- 
graph or  letter,  obtain  information  as  to  Titles,  etc. 

Having  made  favorable  arrangements  for  the  Reduction  and  Treatment 
Of  Ores  in  this  City,  we  solicit  consignments  of  the  same,  upon  terms  which  will 
be  make  known  upon  application. 

Orders  from  the  Interior,  to  sell  or  purchase,  will  receive  prompt  and  faithful  attention.

ADVERTISING     DEPARTMENT. 


511 


HALE'S  Mil© 

—  OR, — 

COAL  OIL  BURNER 

Is  now  generally  acknowledged  to  be 

SUPERIOR  T©  AM*  OTHI1I 

In  use.     A  moment's  examination  will  convince 
any  one  of  this  fact. 

The  ADJUSTABLE   TUBE 


Embodies  a  principle  in  the  production  of  light  which 
no  other  lamp  possesses.  The  wick,  being  stationery,  is 
fixed,  when  trimmed  and  ready  to  burn,  so  that  the  top 
of  it  reaches  to  JUST  THAT  POINT  in  the  SOLAR 
CAP  where  the  draft  is  perfect,  and  as  a  consequence 

THE  COMBUSTION  IS  COMPLETE! 

It  is  a  significant  fact  and  one  which  all  who  propose  to  use  the 
COAL  OIIL,  TuAJl&F 
OUGHT  TO  KNOW,  that  in  ALL  lamps  where  the  wick  is  moved  up  to  get  the 
light,  instead  of  being  stationary  and  the  tube  sliding  down  off  of  it,  as  in  Hale's, 
the  wick,  when  the  light  is  all  "  on,"  is  raised  from  one-quarter  to  three-eights  of  an 
inch  nearer  the  ¥  solar  cap  "  than  it  is  in  HALE'S  ;  the  consequence  of  which  is, 
that  the  draft  and  combustion  so  necessary  to  produce  a  perfect  light  becomes 
deranged,  and  a  portion  of  the  oil  escapes  into  the  room,  creating  not  only  an  offen- 
sive odor,  but  causing  a  great  waste  of  burning  material. 

Another  and  a  serious  difficulty  with  all  moveable  wicks  is,  that  they  are  inclined 
to  STICK  IN  THE  TUBE.  Another  is,  that  the  spurs  bv  which  they  are  moved 
up  frequently  THROW  THEM  UP  UNEVENLY,  causing  smoke  before  a 
proper   amount  of  light  is  obtained.     These  difficulties  are  all  obviated  in 

HALE'S   STATIONARY   WICK. 
Recent  advices  from  the  Atlantic  States  apprise  us  of  the  fact  "  That  there  is  no 
sale  for  any  moveable  wick  burners  where 

HALE'S   ADJUSTABLE    TUBE 

can  be  obtained."  We  wish  also  to  call  the  attention  of  the  public  to  the  diffierent 
kinds  of  POOR  COAL  OILS  in  the  market.  These  cheap  Oils  have  been  shipped 
to  this  State  to  find  a  market,  because  the  game  has  been  "  played  out "  where  the 
article  is  known.  We  are  in  receipt  bv  every  arrival  of  a  PURE  ARTICLE  of 
KEROSENE  and  PHENOLINE,  which  we  WARRANT  to  be  of  the  YERY 
BEST  QUALITY— WHITE  AND  LIMPID. 

Remember  that  HALE'S  LAMP  can  be  obtained  only  of  us. 

BEAGG    &    CO., 

200  WASHINGTON  STREET,  Sole  Agents  for  the  Pacific  Coast.

ADVERTISING     DEPARTMENT.  515 

TO  THE  AGRICULTURAL  PUBLIC. 


The  Subscriber  desires  to  express  to  his  friends  and  patrons  his  warm  and  unreserved  thanks  for  their  kind  and 
much-needed  support  during  the  past  year,  which  has  far  exceeded  his  most  sanguine  expectations,  and  which  he 
hopes  to  retain  by  pursuing  such  a  course  as  may  bo  satisfactory  to  his  patrons  and  honorable  to  himself.  He 
desires,  therefore,  to  call  their  attention  to  a  list  of  some  of  the  leading  atticles  which  ho  will  offer  for  sale  for  1860: 


Pitt's    Genuine    Buffalo  Thrasher,   8  and  10  horse-power,   with  an  attachment  for 
measuring  and  registering  the  number  of  bushels  thrashed,  and  bagging  the  grain. 

C.  M.  Russell's,  Massillon,  Ohio,  Thrasher,  8  and  io  horse-power. 
Ball's  Celebrated  Canton,  Ohio,  do.  8  and  io         do. 

The  Albany,  New  York,  do.  l  and    2         do. 

The  above  Machines  were  made  expressly  to  order  for  the  California  market. 

ALSO,   HAY!  ON   HAND, 

Extra  Castings,  Drapers,  Elevators,  Cylinder  Teeth,  etc.  etc.,  for  all  the  above  Machines. 

The  California  Combined  Reaper  and  Mower, 

To  which  was  awarded  the  FIRST  PREMIUM  over  the  New  York  Reaper,  on  trial  as  a  Combined  Reaper  and 
Mower,  at  the  Alameda  County  Agricultural  Fair,  held  in  June  last.    Also,  the  same  award  was  made  at  the  State 
Fair,  held  at  Sacramento,  in  September  last;  and  at  the  Santa  Clara  County  Fair,  held  in  San  Jose,  in  October  last. 
Your  attention  is  also  called  to  a  notice  given  it,  below,  by  numerous  members  of  the  State  Agricultural  Society. 


PECK'S   HEADER  AND   HARVESTER, 

To  which  was  also  awarded  the  FIRST  PREMIUM  at  the  Stato  Fair,  and  at  the  Santa  Clara  County  Fair.    With  the 
experience  of  the  past  season,  this  Machine  is  so  improved  as  to  be,  without  question,  the  very  best  Harvester  in  use. 

SIOZLE     SECTIONS. 

Sickle  Sections  for  McCormiek's,  Hussey's,   Burrill's,  Seymour  &  Morgan's,  Palmer  &  Williams', 

and  Manny's  (with  Wood's  Improvement)  Reapers. 
ALSO,  EXTRA  CASTINGS  AND  BRASS  BOXES  FOR  THE  ABOVE  MACHINES. 


^REPAIRING    DONE    ON    SHORT    NOTICE."® 


J.  S.  HARBISON'S  PATENT  BEE-HIVES,  which  took  the  FIRST  PREMIUM  at  the  State  Fair,  and 
which  is  the  very  best  Bee-Hive  in  use,  are  for  sale;  and,  also,  persons  wishing  to  manufacture  these  Hives,  can 
purchase  the  Right  of  us. 

THOS.   OCG   SHAW, 

No.  33  Sacramento  Street,  San  Francisco. 

We,  the  undersigned,  members  of  the  State  Agricultural  Society  of  California,  have  seen  and  examined  the  newly 
improved  CALIFORNIA  COMBINED  RKAPEli  AND  MOWEIi,  manufactured  by  THOMAS  OGG  SHAW,  of  San 
Francisco,  California,  for  which  a  patent  has  been  applied  for;  and.  in  pur  judgment,  we  consider  it  one  of  the 
greatest  Improvements  that  has  ever  come  under  our  observation,  of  the  kind  ;  and  we  cheerfully  recommend  to  the 
farming  community  (as  it  is  purely  a  California  invention)  this  machine,  as  one  of  the  best  Combined  Reapers  and 
Mowers  BOW  in  use,  as  it  contains  many  decided  and  valuable  improvements. 

John  G.  Downey,  C..L-  Hutchinson  0.  C.  Wheeler, 

Governor  of  California.  President  Cat.  State  Ag.  Society.  Cor.  Sec.  Cat.  State  Ag.  Society.

Sacramento  Street,  below  Montgomery, 

Opposite  the  Pacific  Mail  Steamship  Co.'s  OfiBce,  S-A.3SJ"    FBANOISCO. 


ESTABLISHED    IN    1854, 

For  the  Permanent  Cure  of  all  Private  and  Chronic  Diseases,  and  for  the  Suppression  of 

Quackery. 


Attending  and  Resident  Physician,  L.  J.  CZAPKAY,  M.  D., 

Late  in  the  Hungarian  Revolutionary  War — Chief  Physician  to  the  20th  Regiment  of  Honveds, 
Chief  Surgeon  to  the  Military  Hospital  of  Pesth,  Hungary — Late  Lecturer  on  the  Diseases 
of  Women  and  Children — And  Honorary  Member  of  the  Philadelphia  College  of  Medicine. 


XG&~  Particular  attention  paid  to  the  Treatment  of  Diseases  peculiar  to  Women 
and  Children.

Permanent  cure  guaranteed,  or  no  pay.  Consultations  by  letter  or  otherwise, 
free.     Address  Dr.  L.  J.  CZAPKAY,  San  Francisco.
